can be removed

Are you suggesting 45 since that is what we believe PCR error to be?
If so, it might be useful to have a comment here explaining the justification for 45.
If this is going to be public, then I think it should have javadoc
the "readthrough bases"? not clear what is meant by that....
unclear what you are trying to do here....could you put a comment in the code?

hmmm. this feels like code that already exists in htsjdk....basically you want to go from a reference position to a readoffset, right? how about htsjdk.samtools.SAMRecord#getReadPositionAtReferencePosition(htsjdk.samtools.SAMRecord, int, boolean) does that help?
comment still stands
the generalizability of having the clipping operator given as such seems like premature optimization...why not just a boolean hardClip ?

Why do we need two read structures? the read structure is something that breaks up the entire stream of cycles into various things: UMIs,  Sample BCs, Template reads, skips...it is not clear (to me!) how a single readStructure should be broken up into to.

This function is awfully complex....but it seems to be doing a combination of things for which other functions already exist...can you explain what it does? perhaps it needs to be broken up into a few smaller methods.
Maybe say, "adapter kit", or something similar just to be more specific

Should there be a check on if FIVE_PRIME_ADAPTER == null and THREE_PRIME_ADAPTER != null and
vice versa?  Maybe throw an exception.

A lot of code duplication here
tesOverlappedReadClippingWithNonOverlappedReads (has misspelling in name)
testOverlappedReadHardClippingWithNonOverlappedReads
testBasicOverlappedReadClipping
are all basically the same thing, they could be consolidated into a single test that uses a data provider.
expectedReadPosToCLipFrom - funny capitalization in CLip
I don't think templateBasesWithUMI or templateBasesRCWithUMI are used.

perhaps let's use non-X (but lowercase) tag, so that we can try to make it a real (upper-cased) tag in hts-specs later. look for a reasonable two-caracter tag name...perhaps cb and cq is not taken? also, need to think what to do if it's clipped from both ends....or perhaps we assert that these bases are only from the end of the read.
I think it's better to use a boolean as there are only 2 resaonable operators here....SOFT and HARD.
(and then the sanity checks below will not be needed)
I think that the bases should be stored in original read order, so that in order to revert, you just need to stick these on the ends of the reverted records.

since soft-clipped bases are not removed, I think that the "h" is superfluous. how about EB and EQ (for End Bases, and End Quality) since in theory, bases could also be (hard-)clipped off of the start of a read..
also, as a //Todo item here to switch to using the htsjdk version if it gets into hts-spec and implemented
is clippingOperator used elsewhere?
add a sanity check that the tags are not already in use. at this point I think it's OK to break if they are in use, but losing data due to overwriting old tags would not be good.

could you split this into three parts:

extract the required bases/qualities
optionally reverse/rev-comp the arrays
set the attributes

while it takes up more lines of code, there's less code duplication.
also, you defined a method to "move bases to tag" so perhaps you should be using it... :-)
please add a test that has an expected sam file with the tags

This method seems overly complicated and doesn't make enough use of existing coordinate switching code like htsjdk.samtools.SAMRecord#getReadPositionAtReferencePosition(htsjdk.samtools.SAMRecord, int, boolean)
if you really need it, it needs to be heavily documented and tested.
as a change in public API, this is annoying. perhaps you should leave the previous method with a default of false?
docuement where the clipped bases/qualities go to
